content:
You are an expert legal adviser on EU regulations, particularly Solvency II.
In case of formula's output in latex format with $, $$ dollar signs.
If none of the sources provided the answer, just say you don't know.
Wat is de charge op aandelen type 1 en type 2?
prompt:
## Question
        

 Wat is de charge op aandelen type 1 en type 2? 


        
## Context
        

 
### source 1 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)

 where:

### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 5

* Header 4: Subsection 3

* Header 5: Article 169
:

 extract:

 **Standard equity risk sub-module**


1. The capital requirement for type 1 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss
in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:


(a) an instantaneous decrease equal to 22 % in the value of type 1 equity investments in related undertakings within the
meaning of Article 212(1)(b) and 212(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC where these investments are of a strategic
nature;


(b) an instantaneous decrease equal to the sum of 39 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of
this Regulation, in the value of type 1 equities other than those referred to in point (a).


2. The capital requirement for type 2 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss
in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:

### source 4 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)

* Header 5: Article 170
:

 extract:

 2. Where an insurance or reinsurance undertaking has received supervisory approval to apply the provisions set out
in Article 304 of Directive 2009/138/EC, the capital requirement for type 2 equities shall be equal to the loss in the
basic own funds that would result from an instantaneous decrease:


(a) equal to 22 % in the value of the type 2 equities corresponding to the business referred to in point (i) of
Article 304(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC;


(b) equal to 22 % in the value of type 2 equity investments in related undertakings within the meaning of
Article 212(1)(b) and (2) of Directive 2009/138/EC, where these investments are of a strategic nature;


(c) equal to the sum of 49 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of this Regulation, in the value
of type 2 equities, other than those referred to in points (a) or (b).
 



### source 5 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 5

* Header 4: Subsection 3

* Header 5: Article 168
:

 extract:

 **General provisions**


1. The equity risk sub-module referred to in point (b) of the second subparagraph of Article 105(5) of Directive/EC shall include a risk sub-module for type 1 equities and a risk sub-module for type 2 equities.


2. Type 1 equities shall comprise equities listed in regulated markets in the countries which are members of the
European Economic Area (EEA) or the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD). 


 


        
## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

content: Op basis van de verstrekte documenten is de kapitaalvereiste (charge) voor aandelen type 1 en type 2 als volgt: ### Aandelen Type 1 De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen van type 1 is gelijk aan het verlies aan tier 1-basiseigen vermogen dat zou voortvloeien uit de volgende onmiddellijke dalingen (): * Een onmiddellijke daling van **22%** in de waarde van strategische type 1-aandelenbeleggingen in verbonden ondernemingen. * Een onmiddellijke daling gelijk aan de som van **39% en de symmetrische aanpassing** (zoals bedoeld in artikel 172) in de waarde van andere type 1-aandelen. Aandelen van type 1 omvatten aandelen die genoteerd zijn op gereglementeerde markten in landen die lid zijn van de Europese Economische Ruimte (EER) of de Organisatie voor Economische Samenwerking en Ontwikkeling (OESO) (). ### Aandelen Type 2 De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen van type 2 is gelijk aan het verlies aan tier 1-basiseigen vermogen dat zou voortvloeien uit de volgende onmiddellijke dalingen (): * Een onmiddellijke daling van **22%** in de waarde van type 2-aandelen die overeenkomen met specifieke bedrijfsactiviteiten waarvoor de toezichthouder goedkeuring heeft verleend (overeenkomstig artikel 304 van Richtlijn 2009/138/EG). * Een onmiddellijke daling van **22%** in de waarde van strategische type 2-aandelenbeleggingen in verbonden ondernemingen. * Een onmiddellijke daling gelijk aan de som van **49% en de symmetrische aanpassing** (zoals bedoeld in artikel 172) in de waarde van overige type 2-aandelen.
content_unformatted:
Op basis van de verstrekte documenten is de kapitaalvereiste (charge) voor aandelen type 1 en type 2 als volgt:

### Aandelen Type 1
De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen van type 1 is gelijk aan het verlies aan tier 1-basiseigen vermogen dat zou voortvloeien uit de volgende onmiddellijke dalingen (Source 2):

*   Een onmiddellijke daling van **22%** in de waarde van strategische type 1-aandelenbeleggingen in verbonden ondernemingen.
*   Een onmiddellijke daling gelijk aan de som van **39% en de symmetrische aanpassing** (zoals bedoeld in artikel 172) in de waarde van andere type 1-aandelen.

Aandelen van type 1 omvatten aandelen die genoteerd zijn op gereglementeerde markten in landen die lid zijn van de Europese Economische Ruimte (EER) of de Organisatie voor Economische Samenwerking en Ontwikkeling (OESO) (Source 5).

### Aandelen Type 2
De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen van type 2 is gelijk aan het verlies aan tier 1-basiseigen vermogen dat zou voortvloeien uit de volgende onmiddellijke dalingen (Source 4):

*   Een onmiddellijke daling van **22%** in de waarde van type 2-aandelen die overeenkomen met specifieke bedrijfsactiviteiten waarvoor de toezichthouder goedkeuring heeft verleend (overeenkomstig artikel 304 van Richtlijn 2009/138/EG).
*   Een onmiddellijke daling van **22%** in de waarde van strategische type 2-aandelenbeleggingen in verbonden ondernemingen.
*   Een onmiddellijke daling gelijk aan de som van **49% en de symmetrische aanpassing** (zoals bedoeld in artikel 172) in de waarde van overige type 2-aandelen.
popover_elements:
Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 169

Standard equity risk sub-module

  1. The capital requirement for type 1 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:

(a) an instantaneous decrease equal to 22 % in the value of type 1 equity investments in related undertakings within the meaning of Article 212(1)(b) and 212(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC where these investments are of a strategic nature;

(b) an instantaneous decrease equal to the sum of 39 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of this Regulation, in the value of type 1 equities other than those referred to in point (a).

  1. The capital requirement for type 2 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 168

General provisions

  1. The equity risk sub-module referred to in point (b) of the second subparagraph of Article 105(5) of Directive/EC shall include a risk sub-module for type 1 equities and a risk sub-module for type 2 equities.

  2. Type 1 equities shall comprise equities listed in regulated markets in the countries which are members of the European Economic Area (EEA) or the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD).

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 170

  1. Where an insurance or reinsurance undertaking has received supervisory approval to apply the provisions set out in Article 304 of Directive 2009/138/EC, the capital requirement for type 2 equities shall be equal to the loss in the basic own funds that would result from an instantaneous decrease:

(a) equal to 22 % in the value of the type 2 equities corresponding to the business referred to in point (i) of Article 304(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC;

(b) equal to 22 % in the value of type 2 equity investments in related undertakings within the meaning of Article 212(1)(b) and (2) of Directive 2009/138/EC, where these investments are of a strategic nature;

(c) equal to the sum of 49 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of this Regulation, in the value of type 2 equities, other than those referred to in points (a) or (b).
thoughts:
**Clarifying the Query**

I'm zeroing in on the fundamental question: what capital charge applies to "type 1" and "type 2" equities under Solvency II? I've started scanning documents for related keywords like "equity charge," "standard formula," and "capital requirement."


**Defining Equity Requirements**

I've determined that "charge" equates to capital requirements under Solvency II. Articles 168, 169, and 170 are key. Article 169 clarifies the requirements for type 1 equities: a 22% decrease for strategic investments and (39% + symmetric adjustment) for others. Article 168 provides aggregation context. I'm now focusing on defining type 2 equity requirements.


**Unpacking Equity Scenarios**

I've clarified the definition of "charge" as the capital requirement for equities. Now, I've segmented my analysis by equity type, leveraging Articles 169 and 170. I've pinpointed specific percentage decreases for both Type 1 and Type 2 equities, accounting for strategic investments and other considerations. This is the foundation; next, I'll organize these findings concisely.


**Uncovering Equity Percentages**

I've clarified the definition of "charge" as the capital requirement for equities under Solvency II.  The core percentages have now emerged, broken down by equity type and strategic considerations, drawn primarily from Articles 169 and 170. I'm focusing on organizing this information clearly. My next step will be to summarize the specific percentages for easy reference.


**Determining Percentage Requirements**

I'm now zeroing in on the specific percentages. After thoroughly reviewing Articles 169 and 170, I've identified the relevant capital requirement decreases for both Type 1 and Type 2 equities. I'm carefully compiling and formatting these specific figures, separating the requirements based on strategic investments and other scenarios, and noting the symmetrical adjustments. I plan to present this clearly and concisely.

content: Wat is de symmetric adjustment in de context van SCR Aandelenrisico?
prompt:
## Question
        

 Wat is de symmetric adjustment in de context van SCR Aandelenrisico? 


        
## Context
        

 
### source 1 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER VI*

* Header 3: Section 4

* Header 4: Subsection 2

* Header 5: Article 106
:

 extract:

 **Calculation of the equity risk sub-module: symmetric**
**adjustment mechanism**


1. The equity risk sub-module calculated in accordance with
the standard formula shall include a symmetric adjustment to the
equity capital charge applied to cover the risk arising from
changes in the level of equity prices.


2. The symmetric adjustment made to the standard equity
capital charge, calibrated in accordance with Article 104(4), cov­
ering the risk arising from changes in the level of equity prices
shall be based on a function of the current level of an appropriate
equity index and a weighted average level of that index. The
weighted average shall be calculated over an appropriate period
of time which shall be the same for all insurance and reinsurance
undertakings. 



### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER VI*

* Header 3: Section 4

* Header 4: Subsection 2

* Header 5: Article 106
:

 extract:

 3. The symmetric adjustment made to the standard equity
capital charge covering the risk arising from changes in the level
of equity prices shall not result in an equity capital charge being
applied that is more than 10 percentage points lower or 10 per­
centage points higher than the standard equity capital charge. 



### source 3 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 5

* Header 4: Subsection 3

* Header 5: Article 172
:

 extract:

 **Symmetric adjustment of the equity capital charge**


1. The equity index referred to in Article 106(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC shall comply with all of the following
requirements:


(a) the equity index measures the market price of a diversified portfolio of equities which is representative of the nature
of equities typically held by insurance and reinsurance undertakings;


(b) the level of the equity index is publicly available;


(c) the frequency of published levels of the equity index is sufficient to enable the current level of the index and its
average value over the last 36 months to be determined.


2. Subject to paragraph 4, the symmetric adjustment shall be equal to the following:

$$
SA = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \left( \frac{CI - AI}{AI} - 8\% \right)
$$

where:
(a)(a) _CI_ denotes the current level of the equity index;


(b) AI denotes the weighted average of the daily levels of the equity index over the last 36 months. 



### source 4 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 2: DIRECTIVES
:

 extract:

 (61) In order to mitigate undue potential pro-cyclical effects of
the financial system and avoid a situation in which insur­
ance and reinsurance undertakings are unduly forced to
raise additional capital or sell their investments as a result
of unsustained adverse movements in financial markets,
the market risk module of the standard formula for the
Solvency Capital Requirement should include a symmetric
adjustment mechanism with respect to changes in the level

11.72.2009 EN



Official Journ al of the E uropean Un ion L 335/7 



### source 5 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II):

 extract:

 (59) In order to avoid the effects of pro-cyclicality, the time period for the symmetric adjustment mechanism to the
equity risk sub-module should strike a balance between maintaining risk-sensitivity of the sub-module and
reflecting the objective of the symmetric adjustment.


(60) When a matching adjustment is applied in the calculation of the best estimate of insurance or reinsurance
obligations, the calculation of the Solvency Capital Requirement in the spread risk sub-module should capture
the impact of changes in asset spreads on the matching adjustment and thus on the value of technical provisions.


(61) Considering that the risk-profile of property located in third countries is not materially different from that of
property located in the Union, the property risk sub-module of the standard formula should treat these two types
of exposures in the same way. 


 


        
## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

**Calculation of the equity risk sub-module: symmetric**
**adjustment mechanism**


1. The equity risk sub-module calculated in accordance with
the standard formula shall include a symmetric adjustment to the
equity capital charge applied to cover the risk arising from
changes in the level of equity prices.


2. The symmetric adjustment made to the standard equity
capital charge, calibrated in accordance with Article 104(4), cov­
ering the risk arising from changes in the level of equity prices
shall be based on a function of the current level of an appropriate
equity index and a weighted average level of that index. The
weighted average shall be calculated over an appropriate period
of time which shall be the same for all insurance and reinsurance
undertakings.

sources.page_content:
**Symmetric adjustment of the equity capital charge**


1. The equity index referred to in Article 106(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC shall comply with all of the following
requirements:


(a) the equity index measures the market price of a diversified portfolio of equities which is representative of the nature
of equities typically held by insurance and reinsurance undertakings;


(b) the level of the equity index is publicly available;


(c) the frequency of published levels of the equity index is sufficient to enable the current level of the index and its
average value over the last 36 months to be determined.


2. Subject to paragraph 4, the symmetric adjustment shall be equal to the following:

$$
SA = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \left( \frac{CI - AI}{AI} - 8\% \right)
$$

where:
(a)(a) _CI_ denotes the current level of the equity index;


(b) AI denotes the weighted average of the daily levels of the equity index over the last 36 months.

sources.query: Wat is de symmetric adjustment in de context van SCR Aandelenrisico?

sources.title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
sources.page_content:
(59) In order to avoid the effects of pro-cyclicality, the time period for the symmetric adjustment mechanism to the
equity risk sub-module should strike a balance between maintaining risk-sensitivity of the sub-module and
reflecting the objective of the symmetric adjustment.


(60) When a matching adjustment is applied in the calculation of the best estimate of insurance or reinsurance
obligations, the calculation of the Solvency Capital Requirement in the spread risk sub-module should capture
the impact of changes in asset spreads on the matching adjustment and thus on the value of technical provisions.


(61) Considering that the risk-profile of property located in third countries is not materially different from that of
property located in the Union, the property risk sub-module of the standard formula should treat these two types
of exposures in the same way.
sources.query: Wat is de symmetric adjustment in de context van SCR Aandelenrisico?

content: Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen is de symmetrische aanpassing (symmetric adjustment) in de context van het Solvency Capital Requirement (SCR) voor aandelenrisico het volgende: ### Doel en Definitie De symmetrische aanpassing is een mechanisme binnen de standaardformule dat de kapitaalvereiste voor aandelenrisico aanpast om procyclische effecten te beperken (). Het doel is te voorkomen dat verzekeraars gedwongen worden kapitaal aan te trekken of beleggingen te verkopen als gevolg van ongunstige, maar niet-duurzame, bewegingen op de financiële markten (). De aanpassing is gebaseerd op een functie van het huidige niveau van een relevante aandelenindex en het gewogen gemiddelde niveau van die index over een bepaalde periode (). ### Berekening De symmetrische aanpassing wordt berekend met de volgende formule (): $$ SA = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \left( \frac{CI - AI}{AI} - 8\% \right) $$ Waarbij: * **SA**: de symmetrische aanpassing. * **CI**: het huidige niveau van de aandelenindex. * **AI**: het gewogen gemiddelde van de dagelijkse niveaus van de aandelenindex over de laatste 36 maanden. ### Limieten De symmetrische aanpassing mag niet resulteren in een kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen die meer dan 10 procentpunten lager of 10 procentpunten hoger is dan de standaard kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen ().
content_unformatted:
Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen is de symmetrische aanpassing (symmetric adjustment) in de context van het Solvency Capital Requirement (SCR) voor aandelenrisico het volgende:

### Doel en Definitie
De symmetrische aanpassing is een mechanisme binnen de standaardformule dat de kapitaalvereiste voor aandelenrisico aanpast om procyclische effecten te beperken (Source 4, 5). Het doel is te voorkomen dat verzekeraars gedwongen worden kapitaal aan te trekken of beleggingen te verkopen als gevolg van ongunstige, maar niet-duurzame, bewegingen op de financiële markten (Source 4).

De aanpassing is gebaseerd op een functie van het huidige niveau van een relevante aandelenindex en het gewogen gemiddelde niveau van die index over een bepaalde periode (Source 1).

### Berekening
De symmetrische aanpassing wordt berekend met de volgende formule (Source 3):

$$
SA = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \left( \frac{CI - AI}{AI} - 8\% \right)
$$

Waarbij:
*   **SA**: de symmetrische aanpassing.
*   **CI**: het huidige niveau van de aandelenindex.
*   **AI**: het gewogen gemiddelde van de dagelijkse niveaus van de aandelenindex over de laatste 36 maanden.

### Limieten
De symmetrische aanpassing mag niet resulteren in een kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen die meer dan 10 procentpunten lager of 10 procentpunten hoger is dan de standaard kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen (Source 2).
popover_elements:
Solvency II – Level 1 Directive

DIRECTIVES

(61) In order to mitigate undue potential pro-cyclical effects of the financial system and avoid a situation in which insur­ ance and reinsurance undertakings are unduly forced to raise additional capital or sell their investments as a result of unsustained adverse movements in financial markets, the market risk module of the standard formula for the Solvency Capital Requirement should include a symmetric adjustment mechanism with respect to changes in the level

11.72.2009 EN

Official Journ al of the E uropean Un ion L 335/7

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

(59) In order to avoid the effects of pro-cyclicality, the time period for the symmetric adjustment mechanism to the equity risk sub-module should strike a balance between maintaining risk-sensitivity of the sub-module and reflecting the objective of the symmetric adjustment.

(60) When a matching adjustment is applied in the calculation of the best estimate of insurance or reinsurance obligations, the calculation of the Solvency Capital Requirement in the spread risk sub-module should capture the impact of changes in asset spreads on the matching adjustment and thus on the value of technical provisions.

(61) Considering that the risk-profile of property located in third countries is not materially different from that of property located in the Union, the property risk sub-module of the standard formula should treat these two types of exposures in the same way.

Solvency II – Level 1 Directive

DIRECTIVES

(61) In order to mitigate undue potential pro-cyclical effects of the financial system and avoid a situation in which insur­ ance and reinsurance undertakings are unduly forced to raise additional capital or sell their investments as a result of unsustained adverse movements in financial markets, the market risk module of the standard formula for the Solvency Capital Requirement should include a symmetric adjustment mechanism with respect to changes in the level

11.72.2009 EN

Official Journ al of the E uropean Un ion L 335/7

Solvency II – Level 1 Directive

TITLE I > CHAPTER VI > Section 4 > Subsection 2 > Article 106

Calculation of the equity risk sub-module: symmetric adjustment mechanism

  1. The equity risk sub-module calculated in accordance with the standard formula shall include a symmetric adjustment to the equity capital charge applied to cover the risk arising from changes in the level of equity prices.

  2. The symmetric adjustment made to the standard equity capital charge, calibrated in accordance with Article 104(4), cov­ ering the risk arising from changes in the level of equity prices shall be based on a function of the current level of an appropriate equity index and a weighted average level of that index. The weighted average shall be calculated over an appropriate period of time which shall be the same for all insurance and reinsurance undertakings.

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 172

Symmetric adjustment of the equity capital charge

  1. The equity index referred to in Article 106(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC shall comply with all of the following requirements:

(a) the equity index measures the market price of a diversified portfolio of equities which is representative of the nature of equities typically held by insurance and reinsurance undertakings;

(b) the level of the equity index is publicly available;

(c) the frequency of published levels of the equity index is sufficient to enable the current level of the index and its average value over the last 36 months to be determined.

  1. Subject to paragraph 4, the symmetric adjustment shall be equal to the following:
SA = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \left( \frac{CI - AI}{AI} - 8\% \right)

where: (a)(a) CI denotes the current level of the equity index;

(b) AI denotes the weighted average of the daily levels of the equity index over the last 36 months.

Solvency II – Level 1 Directive

TITLE I > CHAPTER VI > Section 4 > Subsection 2 > Article 106

  1. The symmetric adjustment made to the standard equity capital charge covering the risk arising from changes in the level of equity prices shall not result in an equity capital charge being applied that is more than 10 percentage points lower or 10 per­ centage points higher than the standard equity capital charge.

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)

* Header 5: Article 169
:

 extract:

 **Standard equity risk sub-module**


1. The capital requirement for type 1 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss
in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:


(a) an instantaneous decrease equal to 22 % in the value of type 1 equity investments in related undertakings within the
meaning of Article 212(1)(b) and 212(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC where these investments are of a strategic
nature;


(b) an instantaneous decrease equal to the sum of 39 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of
this Regulation, in the value of type 1 equities other than those referred to in point (a).


2. The capital requirement for type 2 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss
in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases: 



### source 4 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: _ANNEX IV_
:

 extract:

 4. **Calculation of the market risk module**


Structure of the market risk module


The market risk module, set out in Article 105(5) shall be equal to the following:

$$
\text{SCR}_{\text{market}} = \sqrt{\sum_{i,j} \text{Corr}_{i,j} \times \text{SCR}_i \times \text{SCR}_j}
$$


where SCR i denotes the sub-module i and SCR j denotes the sub-module j, and where ‘i,j’ means that the sum of the dif­
ferent terms should cover all possible combinations of i and j. In the calculation, SCR i and SCR j are replaced by the
following:


— SCR interest rate denotes the interest rate risk sub-module,


— SCR equity denotes the equity risk sub-module,


— SCR property denotes the property risk sub-module,


— SCR spread denotes the spread risk sub-module,


— SCR concentration denotes the market risk concentrations sub-module,


— SCR currency denotes the currency risk sub-module,
 



### source 5 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 5

* Header 4: Subsection 3

* Header 5: Article 170
:

 extract:

 2. Where an insurance or reinsurance undertaking has received supervisory approval to apply the provisions set out
in Article 304 of Directive 2009/138/EC, the capital requirement for type 2 equities shall be equal to the loss in the
basic own funds that would result from an instantaneous decrease:


(a) equal to 22 % in the value of the type 2 equities corresponding to the business referred to in point (i) of
Article 304(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC;


(b) equal to 22 % in the value of type 2 equity investments in related undertakings within the meaning of
Article 212(1)(b) and (2) of Directive 2009/138/EC, where these investments are of a strategic nature;


(c) equal to the sum of 49 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of this Regulation, in the value
of type 2 equities, other than those referred to in points (a) or (b).
 


 


        
## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

sources.query: Kan je een rekenvoorbeeld geven voor de berekening van de SCR Aandelenrisico, met een allocatie naar zowel aandelen type 1 als type 2?

content: Zeker, hier is een rekenvoorbeeld voor de berekening van de Solvency Capital Requirement (SCR) voor aandelenrisico, gebaseerd op de verstrekte bronnen. ### Hypothetische Aandelenportefeuille Stel, een verzekeraar heeft de volgende aandelen in portefeuille: * **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 1 (niet-strategisch):** € 1.000.000 * **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 1 (strategisch, in verbonden onderneming):** € 200.000 * **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 2 (niet-strategisch):** € 500.000 * **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 2 (strategisch, in verbonden onderneming):** € 100.000 We nemen ook aan dat de **symmetrische aanpassing (SA)** op dit moment **-2%** bedraagt. --- ### Stap 1: Berekening van de SCR voor Aandelen Type 1 (`SCR_type1equities`) De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen type 1 is de som van de verliezen door de voorgeschreven schokken (). 1. **Schok op strategische aandelen type 1:** * Schokpercentage: 22% * Berekening: `€ 200.000 * 22% = € 44.000` 2. **Schok op niet-strategische aandelen type 1:** * Schokpercentage: 39% + symmetrische aanpassing * Berekening: `€ 1.000.000 * (39% - 2%) = € 1.000.000 * 37% = € 370.000` 3. **Totaal `SCR_type1equities`:** * `€ 44.000 + € 370.000 = € 414.000` --- ### Stap 2: Berekening van de SCR voor Aandelen Type 2 (`SCR_type2equities`) De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen type 2 is de som van de verliezen door de voorgeschreven schokken (). 1. **Schok op strategische aandelen type 2:** * Schokpercentage: 22% * Berekening: `€ 100.000 * 22% = € 22.000` 2. **Schok op niet-strategische aandelen type 2:** * Schokpercentage: 49% + symmetrische aanpassing * Berekening: `€ 500.000 * (49% - 2%) = € 500.000 * 47% = € 235.000` 3. **Totaal `SCR_type2equities`:** * `€ 22.000 + € 235.000 = € 257.000` --- ### Stap 3: Aggregatie van de totale SCR Aandelenrisico (`SCR_equity`) De totale kapitaalvereiste voor aandelenrisico wordt berekend door de kapitaalvereisten voor type 1 en type 2 te aggregeren met een correlatiefactor van 0,75, volgens de formule in Artikel 168(4) (). De formule is: $$ SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{SCR_{type1equities}^2 + 2 \cdot 0,75 \cdot SCR_{type1equities} \cdot SCR_{type2equities} + SCR_{type2equities}^2} $$ Invullen van de berekende waarden: * `SCR_type1equities` = € 414.000 * `SCR_type2equities` = € 257.000 $$ SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{(414.000)^2 + 1,5 \cdot (414.000) \cdot (257.000) + (257.000)^2} $$ $$ SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{171.396.000.000 + 159.597.000.000 + 66.049.000.000} $$ $$ SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{397.042.000.000} $$ $$ SCR_{equity} \approx € 630.113 $$ De totale kapitaalvereiste voor het aandelenrisico (`SCR_equity`) voor deze portefeuille bedraagt dus **€ 630.113**.
content_unformatted:
Zeker, hier is een rekenvoorbeeld voor de berekening van de Solvency Capital Requirement (SCR) voor aandelenrisico, gebaseerd op de verstrekte bronnen.

### Hypothetische Aandelenportefeuille
Stel, een verzekeraar heeft de volgende aandelen in portefeuille:
*   **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 1 (niet-strategisch):** € 1.000.000
*   **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 1 (strategisch, in verbonden onderneming):** € 200.000
*   **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 2 (niet-strategisch):** € 500.000
*   **Marktwaarde Aandelen Type 2 (strategisch, in verbonden onderneming):** € 100.000

We nemen ook aan dat de **symmetrische aanpassing (SA)** op dit moment **-2%** bedraagt.

---

### Stap 1: Berekening van de SCR voor Aandelen Type 1 (`SCR_type1equities`)

De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen type 1 is de som van de verliezen door de voorgeschreven schokken (Source 3).

1.  **Schok op strategische aandelen type 1:**
    *   Schokpercentage: 22%
    *   Berekening: `€ 200.000 * 22% = € 44.000`

2.  **Schok op niet-strategische aandelen type 1:**
    *   Schokpercentage: 39% + symmetrische aanpassing
    *   Berekening: `€ 1.000.000 * (39% - 2%) = € 1.000.000 * 37% = € 370.000`

3.  **Totaal `SCR_type1equities`:**
    *   `€ 44.000 + € 370.000 = € 414.000`

---

### Stap 2: Berekening van de SCR voor Aandelen Type 2 (`SCR_type2equities`)

De kapitaalvereiste voor aandelen type 2 is de som van de verliezen door de voorgeschreven schokken (Source 5).

1.  **Schok op strategische aandelen type 2:**
    *   Schokpercentage: 22%
    *   Berekening: `€ 100.000 * 22% = € 22.000`

2.  **Schok op niet-strategische aandelen type 2:**
    *   Schokpercentage: 49% + symmetrische aanpassing
    *   Berekening: `€ 500.000 * (49% - 2%) = € 500.000 * 47% = € 235.000`

3.  **Totaal `SCR_type2equities`:**
    *   `€ 22.000 + € 235.000 = € 257.000`

---

### Stap 3: Aggregatie van de totale SCR Aandelenrisico (`SCR_equity`)

De totale kapitaalvereiste voor aandelenrisico wordt berekend door de kapitaalvereisten voor type 1 en type 2 te aggregeren met een correlatiefactor van 0,75, volgens de formule in Artikel 168(4) (Source 1).

De formule is:
$$
SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{SCR_{type1equities}^2 + 2 \cdot 0,75 \cdot SCR_{type1equities} \cdot SCR_{type2equities} + SCR_{type2equities}^2}
$$

Invullen van de berekende waarden:
*   `SCR_type1equities` = € 414.000
*   `SCR_type2equities` = € 257.000

$$
SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{(414.000)^2 + 1,5 \cdot (414.000) \cdot (257.000) + (257.000)^2}
$$

$$
SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{171.396.000.000 + 159.597.000.000 + 66.049.000.000}
$$

$$
SCR_{equity} = \sqrt{397.042.000.000}
$$

$$
SCR_{equity} \approx € 630.113
$$

De totale kapitaalvereiste voor het aandelenrisico (`SCR_equity`) voor deze portefeuille bedraagt dus **€ 630.113**.

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 169

Standard equity risk sub-module

  1. The capital requirement for type 1 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:

(a) an instantaneous decrease equal to 22 % in the value of type 1 equity investments in related undertakings within the meaning of Article 212(1)(b) and 212(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC where these investments are of a strategic nature;

(b) an instantaneous decrease equal to the sum of 39 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of this Regulation, in the value of type 1 equities other than those referred to in point (a).

  1. The capital requirement for type 2 equities referred to in Article 168 of this Regulation shall be equal to the loss in the basic own funds that would result from the following instantaneous decreases:

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 170

  1. Where an insurance or reinsurance undertaking has received supervisory approval to apply the provisions set out in Article 304 of Directive 2009/138/EC, the capital requirement for type 2 equities shall be equal to the loss in the basic own funds that would result from an instantaneous decrease:

(a) equal to 22 % in the value of the type 2 equities corresponding to the business referred to in point (i) of Article 304(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC;

(b) equal to 22 % in the value of type 2 equity investments in related undertakings within the meaning of Article 212(1)(b) and (2) of Directive 2009/138/EC, where these investments are of a strategic nature;

(c) equal to the sum of 49 % and the symmetric adjustment as referred to in Article 172 of this Regulation, in the value of type 2 equities, other than those referred to in points (a) or (b).

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER V > Section 5 > Subsection 3 > Article 168

  1. The capital requirement for equity risk shall be equal to the following:

where:

(a) SCR type 1 equities denotes the capital requirement for type 1 equities;
